challengeName: Hercules OnCampus Android App - Crash in DefaultMediaPlayer.seek
detailedRequirements:
Overview

The Hercules University application is a set of apps for iOS, Android, and the web, allowing users to watch live TV and On Demand videos on Universities.

This F2F challenge applies to the *ANDROID* application.

Code

The existing code is here:

https://gitlab.com/team-autobots/oncampus-android/

You will need to use Android Studio to build the code and will only be able to fully test on an actual device, not in the simulator.

If you need code access, please request in the F2F TopCoder forum with your Gitlab username. You will be given read-only access.

If you receive a 404 error when hitting the Gitlab link, it means you do NOT have access. Please request access in the challenge forum. Within 24 hours you will receive an email from Gitlab that states you have access. This is NOT an automatic process - it is handled manually.

Please ask any questions in the TopCoder forum or on Gitlab. Either is appropriate.

Building Code

There is a README.md file here that explains test accounts and how to build the app:

https://gitlab.com/team-autobots/oncampus-android/blob/develop/README.md

Ignore the direct tickets documentation if you donâ€™t have write access to the repository.

Submission

Your submission to OR should be a Git patch file that can be applied to see the fixes. Here is documentation on how to generate a Git patch file:

https://ariejan.net/2009/10/26/how-to-create-and-apply-a-patch-with-git/

Crash

The crash details can be found here:

http://crashes.to/s/e23e18c5450

This crash is likely due to the "setPosition" call being made at the wrong time, or the "play" call being made at the wrong time.  Please make sure to include instructions on how to reproduce the crash and what was done to fix it.  Do not just add a try / catch!  We want to fix the error, not suppress it!

If you want to look at the code being run, look at the release/1.5.10 branch or the develop branch.  Right now they are both the same and match the build that threw this exception.

Stack trace:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Invalid player status [ IDLE] for operation [play].

       at com.hercules.quantum.dc.mediaOpened(QuantumActivity.java:5644)
       at com.comcast.playerplatform.primetime.android.events.PlayerEventManager$13.run(PlayerEventManager.java:219)
       at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739)
       at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95)
       at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:145)
       at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5942)
